page.title: 15Farming in the Block
page.content: This block is largely agricultural, and a very successful one too. The farms are mainly arable. The crops grown are things that do not need a lot of water as the whole area drains into the River Nene. They include wheat, barley and beans. Many farmers grow sugarbeet, because of the nearby sugar processing factory at Peterborough. A newly introduced crop is oil seed rape which is very profitable. The farms are highly mechanised and the farmers employ only one or two workers at the most. The fields nowadays are very large and the old field hedges have been grubbed up to make the large fields. One local farmer has sheep and another has dairy cows. Most farms have beef cattle they fatten during the summer.
